intro: Xanthophyllum pulchrum subsp. pulchrum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers, which are typically bell-shaped and arranged in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, hairy texture.
